dspace-development.title: Troubleshoot and document the solution for authentication issues on the Symplectic Elements QA and Production environments

comments.body: While the ports are opened, the `rt4ds` Tomcat app. has not been deployed on the `staging` or `dev` environments.

The result of careless query-replace.  Fixed now

On Sep 24, 2020, at 20:12, Trey Pendragon <notifications@github.com<mailto:notifications@github.com>> wrote:



@tpendragon requested changes on this pull request.

________________________________

In lib/tasks/bulk.rake<https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/pull/4270#discussion_r494677096>:

> @@ -314,4 +314,15 @@ namespace :bulk do
       @logger.error "Error: #{e.message}"
     end
   end
+
+  desc "Adds all members of a Collection to an additional collection"
+  task update_attrs: :environment do
+    coll = ENV["COLL"]
+    append_coll = ENV["APPEND_COLL"]
+
+    abort "usage: rake bulk:update_attrs COLL=[collection id] APPEND_COLL=[new collection id]" unless coll && append_coll
+    logger = Logger.new(STDOUT)
+    attrs = { member_of_collection_ids: Valkyrie::ID.new(append_coll) }


This should be :append_collection_ids now.

marc_liberation.title: Update traject to process Alma records
Updating whenever to run on correct boxes
Retrieve full availability using the Alma API

comments.body:
the structure of the bib object: https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/xsd/rest_bib.xsd/?tags=GET. 
 
`GET /almaws/v1/bibs/{mms_id}`
Adding expand=p_avail: will add an **AVA** (availability) tag in the record with the physical availability:
`https://api-na.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/almaws/v1/bibs/991129830000541?expand=p_avail`
will return: 
```
<datafield ind1=" " ind2=" " tag="AVA">
            <subfield code="0">991129830000541</subfield>   mms_id
            <subfield code="8">224687740000541</subfield>   holding_id
            <subfield code="a">01PRI_INST</subfield>  Institution code
            <subfield code="b">MAIN</subfield>  library value
            <subfield code="c">Stacks</subfield>  location desc
            <subfield code="d">292 H31m</subfield>  call_number
            <subfield code="e">available</subfield>  availability
            <subfield code="f">1</subfield>  total items               
            <subfield code="g">0</subfield>  non available items                               
            <subfield code="j">main</subfield>  Location code  
            <subfield code="k">8</subfield>  Call number type
            <subfield code="p">1</subfield>  priority  
            <subfield code="q">Main Library</subfield> library desc
        </datafield>
```

Edit to add: Note that the availability here will be one of 3 values: "available", "unavailable", "check holdings"

We identified with @mzelesky that the availability of a specific item **misses** `sequence` and `on_reserve`. We use them in: https://github.com/pulibrary/voyager_helpers/blob/26166ac7e68bfce5d5326f11c0a05933f2b07880/lib/voyager_helpers/liberator.rb#L283

GET `/almaws/v1/bibs/{mms_id}/holdings/{holding_id}/items` This will retrieve the items list.

> Edit to add: Note that we can get all item information by using a holdings number `ALL`

If we want Item and label printing information, use item_pid from the record. 
GET `/almaws/v1/bibs/{mms_id}/holdings/{holding_id}/items/{item_pid}`

The item_data also includes **barcode** information. https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/xsd/rest_item.xsd/#item
`barcode: The item's barcode.
If not sent as part of the PUT or POST actions, Alma will generate a barcode based on the barcode generation rules.`

marc_liberation.title: Ask exlibris how often we can have a full dump

comments.body: We can have a full dump of data daily, weekly, monthly.  The team will determine what we need.

marc_liberation.title: Investigate real-time availability indexing in Alma

comments.body:
- [x] Indexing availability information from the **daily** incremental dumps from Alma. Set up a publishing job. https://github.com/pulibrary/marc_liberation/issues/651
- [x] Real time on search results and the record display and the requests page. https://github.com/pulibrary/marc_liberation/issues/641
- [x] Full reindex. Make sure this ad hoc job of a full dump would include the availability. https://github.com/pulibrary/marc_liberation/issues/649
- [x] Ask exlibris how often we can have a full dump. https://github.com/pulibrary/marc_liberation/issues/650
This has been sufficiently investigated.

pomegranate.title: Duplicate database entries for custom field override-title_ssim

comments.body:
Final thoughts here: 

from @tpendragon: "I think the issue was the custom fields make two override titles when reindexing happens across multiple threads, then if the most recent one that got created has a weird slug that issue we found happens."

Regarding how the slug was created to begin with, this "slug candidate" functionality in friendly_id seems relevant. here's some documentation in case we need it down the line:

- http://norman.github.io/friendly_id/5.0/
- https://github.com/norman/friendly_id/blob/e9a591b09c70e788fb35a7f45c5e146e94355f2c/lib/friendly_id/slugged.rb

It's being set up here in spotlight: https://github.com/projectblacklight/spotlight/blob/e7060283bd8b7478bc74f4dcfcf6bed72e6aa3f0/app/models/spotlight/custom_field.rb#L101
